items.name: Bumthang Valley – Explore The Switzerland Of East
items.section_title: Bumthang Valley – Explore The Switzerland Of East
items.section_excerpt: Among the best things to do in Bhutan is to take the Bumthang Cultural Trek and explore much more than the beauty of the Bumthang valley. The cultural trek offers picturesque views of the monasteries, temples, and quaint villages. You also get to explore the beautiful villages and experience great hospitality. Until the 1970s, the area was only accessible by muddy trails and mules. Ura Valley is a…
items.description: Among the best things to do in Bhutan is to take the Bumthang Cultural Trek and explore much more than the beauty of the Bumthang valley. The cultural trek offers picturesque views of the monasteries, temples, and quaint villages. You also get to explore the beautiful villages and experience great hospitality. Until the 1970s, the area was only accessible by muddy trails and mules. Ura Valley is another place lost in the mist of time in Bumthang. Quaint villages with clustered houses, potato fields, and sheep pastures. This is the kind of valley where you can go on a photo walk. Besides the breathtaking mountains and natural beauty, Bumthang valley is blessed with some of the oldest Buddhist temples in Bhutan. It is also the place where Buddhism was first introduced and where saint Pema Lingpa was born.
items.location_hint: Central Bhutan, in the Bumthang district
query_hints: Bumthang Valley – Explore The Switzerland Of East
Bumthang Valley – Explore The Switzerland Of East Bhutan
Bumthang Valley – Explore The Switzerland Of East Central Bhutan, in the Bumthang district

items.name: Trashiyangtse – Hike To This Heavenly Place
items.section_title: Trashiyangtse – Hike To This Heavenly Place
items.section_excerpt: If nature mesmerizes you, a visit to Trashiyangtse is going to be captivating, to say the least. Born out of Trashigang district in 1992 as a separate district, it sits in the middle of a small river valley, making it an ideal place for long, refreshing walks in the countryside. Another one of the best things to do in Bhutan is explore one of the most important stupas – Chorten Kora, situated next…
items.description: If nature mesmerizes you, a visit to Trashiyangtse is going to be captivating, to say the least. Born out of Trashigang district in 1992 as a separate district, it sits in the middle of a small river valley, making it an ideal place for long, refreshing walks in the countryside. Another one of the best things to do in Bhutan is explore one of the most important stupas – Chorten Kora, situated next to the Kulong Chu River in Trashiyangtse. Trashiyangtse is also a starting point for hikes to nature reserves, paper workshops, wood carving, and monasteries. If you're interested in bird-watching nearby, then a long walk to Bomdeling Wildlife Sanctuary, which is home to Black-necked Cranes that migrate from Tibet in winter. Bomdeling is also popular for its brilliant woodcraft.
query_hints: Trashiyangtse – Hike To This Heavenly Place
Trashiyangtse – Hike To This Heavenly Place Bhutan
Trashiyangtse – Hike To This Heavenly Place Transhitangtse District, Bhutan

items.name: Wildlife Sanctuaries – Go For Bird Watching
items.section_title: Wildlife Sanctuaries – Go For Bird Watching
items.section_excerpt: The kingdom of Bhutan is a paradise for bird lovers, and bird-watching is one of the most popular Bhutan attractions. The country harbours many species of birds, including the Himalayan Monal, Rufous-necked Hornbill, Black-necked Crane, Ward's Trogon, and Snow Pigeon. It is beautiful to listen to the music of birds and see them soar high in the sky, spreading those colorful, smooth wings. There ar…
items.description: The kingdom of Bhutan is a paradise for bird lovers, and bird-watching is one of the most popular Bhutan attractions. The country harbours many species of birds, including the Himalayan Monal, Rufous-necked Hornbill, Black-necked Crane, Ward's Trogon, and Snow Pigeon. It is beautiful to listen to the music of birds and see them soar high in the sky, spreading those colorful, smooth wings. There are many tour guides around the sanctuaries to take you on a bird-watching tour. Bumdeling Wildlife Sanctuary, Jigme Dorji National Park, Jigme Singye Wangchuck National Park, Adjoining India's World Heritage, and Thrumshingla National Parks are some of the protected areas in Bhutan where you can also find migrating and endangered birds.
items.location_hint: RP9H+M2P, Gasa, Bhutan (Jigme Dorji National Park)
query_hints: Wildlife Sanctuaries – Go For Bird Watching
Wildlife Sanctuaries – Go For Bird Watching Bhutan
Wildlife Sanctuaries – Go For Bird Watching RP9H+M2P, Gasa, Bhutan (Jigme Dorji National Park)

items.name: The Memorial Stupa – Rediscover Yourself
items.section_title: The Memorial Stupa – Rediscover Yourself
items.section_excerpt: If you want to get lost in the realm of peace, then head to The Memorial Stupa built in 1974 in the memory of the third king, Jigme Dorji Wangchuck. The place is also known as the name of Thimphu Chorten and captures the attention of history buffs from all over the world. Representing world peace and honour, the Stupa holds a special place in the hearts of the people of the nation. The Memorial St…
items.description: If you want to get lost in the realm of peace, then head to The Memorial Stupa built in 1974 in the memory of the third king, Jigme Dorji Wangchuck. The place is also known as the name of Thimphu Chorten and captures the attention of history buffs from all over the world. Representing world peace and honour, the Stupa holds a special place in the hearts of the people of the nation. The Memorial Stupa is counted among the most visited sites of Bhutan and features many exciting things such as a photo of the Druk Gyalpo in a ceremonial dress. The stupa is one of the best Bhutan attractions with its shining finial, beautifully carved sculptures of deities, vivid paintings, and ultimate peace. Some hermits and devoted Buddhists often walk into the mountains for months to meditate.
query_hints: The Memorial Stupa – Rediscover Yourself
The Memorial Stupa – Rediscover Yourself Bhutan
The Memorial Stupa – Rediscover Yourself Memorial Stupa, Thimphu, Bhutan

items.name: Shopping – Explore The Local Stores Of Bhutan
items.section_title: Shopping – Explore The Local Stores Of Bhutan
items.section_excerpt: Norzin Lam is the city's major thoroughfare lined with hotels, cafes, stalls, and shops. It's one of the best places to shop in Bhutan. You can get everything from embroidered boots to handmade papers. Some of the good things to buy in Bhutan include carpets, silver, colorful masks, jewelry, hand-woven bamboo items, and wooden products. The lively market offers a wonderful photo opportunity to tou…
items.description: Norzin Lam is the city's major thoroughfare lined with hotels, cafes, stalls, and shops. It's one of the best places to shop in Bhutan. You can get everything from embroidered boots to handmade papers. Some of the good things to buy in Bhutan include carpets, silver, colorful masks, jewelry, hand-woven bamboo items, and wooden products. The lively market offers a wonderful photo opportunity to tourists, explorers, and photographers. Flaunting its vibrant atmosphere and local culture, it is one of the best places in Bhutan where you can indulge in the real essence of Bhutan. Explore variety of goods, including textiles, scarves and craft stalls and have a delightful shopping experience with Bhutan famous things to buy. Although there are countless markets in Bhutan but Norzim Lam is the most famous spot for shoppaholics.
query_hints: Shopping – Explore The Local Stores Of Bhutan
Shopping – Explore The Local Stores Of Bhutan Norzin Lam 1, Thimphu, Bhutan

items.name: Changlimithang Archery Ground – Try Archery
items.section_title: Changlimithang Archery Ground – Try Archery
items.section_excerpt: If you are in Bhutan, you must attend the archery competitions, which are one of the best Bhutan attractions and its national sport, too. While strolling the highways and byways of Bhutan, you'll find colourful gatherings of men dressed in their traditional robes, taking turns to shoot arrows. The archery competitions draw many people to this social event, and competitions are organized between to…
items.description: If you are in Bhutan, you must attend the archery competitions, which are one of the best Bhutan attractions and its national sport, too. While strolling the highways and byways of Bhutan, you'll find colourful gatherings of men dressed in their traditional robes, taking turns to shoot arrows. The archery competitions draw many people to this social event, and competitions are organized between towns, villages, and amateur teams. It's a fantastic glimpse into their culture. Archery is a traditional martial art in Bhutanese culture and is an immersive experience to have in Bhutan. You can also take the help of professionals if you are trying it for the first time. So, while preparing the list of things to do in Bhutan, don't forget to include this gem in your list.
items.location_hint: Bigsa Archery Gallery, Chang Lam SE, Thimphu, Bhutan
query_hints: Changlimithang Archery Ground – Try Archery
Changlimithang Archery Ground – Try Archery Bhutan
Changlimithang Archery Ground – Try Archery Bigsa Archery Gallery, Chang Lam SE, Thimphu, Bhutan

items.description: Image Credit: BrokenSphere for Wikimedia Commons When visiting Bhutan, book your stay in any homestay for a delightful staycation experience. All the homestays and their staff are welcoming and ready to offer your warm hospitality like never before. In these homestays, you can enjoy a glimpse of its local culture and can learn many amazing facts about culture and heritage of Bhutan. Relish home-cooked food that are prepared with organic ingredients and served with love and care. During your Bhutan trip, having an amazing stay experience in this homestay is among the top things to do in Bhutan. Enjoy a perfect retreat and soak in the amazing culture of Bhutan.
query_hints: Experience Staying In A Homestay- Explore Bhutanese Hospitality

items.name: Witness Buddha Dordenma-The Largest Buddha Statue
items.section_title: Witness Buddha Dordenma-The Largest Buddha Statue
items.section_excerpt: Image Credit: אבנר אילנאי for Wikimedia Commons If you are in Bhutan, don't let Buddha Dordenma slip away from your itinerary. Renowned as one of the world's largest Buddha statues, it is a wonderful architectural wonder that will surely offer a great retreat for your eyes and senses. The enormous bronze monument is covered in gold and is more than 50 meters tall. In addition, 125,000 more Buddha …
items.description: Image Credit: אבנר אילנאי for Wikimedia Commons If you are in Bhutan, don't let Buddha Dordenma slip away from your itinerary. Renowned as one of the world's largest Buddha statues, it is a wonderful architectural wonder that will surely offer a great retreat for your eyes and senses. The enormous bronze monument is covered in gold and is more than 50 meters tall. In addition, 125,000 more Buddha statues are housed there and arranged around the Buddha Dordenma statue. It shows how human faith manifests itself and how everyone can live in perpetual peace and happiness. It is thought that the idea was predicted as early as the eighth century in a holy artefact that Guru Padmasambhava preserved.
query_hints: Witness Buddha Dordenma-The Largest Buddha Statue
Witness Buddha Dordenma-The Largest Buddha Statue Bhutan
Witness Buddha Dordenma-The Largest Buddha Statue Kuenselphodrang, Thimphu, Bhutan

items.name: Dance with Monks- Rituals Of Bhutan
items.section_title: Dance with Monks- Rituals Of Bhutan
items.section_excerpt: Image Credit: Sabine Blankevoort for Wikimedia Commons Bhutan is a country deeply passionate about its festivals, and dancing is at the heart of these vibrant celebrations. In this Buddhist nation, even monks join in the joyous festivities, adding their own grace and fervor to traditional dances. During many festivals, monks from local monasteries and Dzongs (temple fortresses) come together to pe…
items.description: Image Credit: Sabine Blankevoort for Wikimedia Commons Bhutan is a country deeply passionate about its festivals, and dancing is at the heart of these vibrant celebrations. In this Buddhist nation, even monks join in the joyous festivities, adding their own grace and fervor to traditional dances. During many festivals, monks from local monasteries and Dzongs (temple fortresses) come together to perform ritualistic dances that honor the occasion. If you're lucky enough to visit a monastery during one of these festivals, you might even have the chance to join in the celebration-a truly unforgettable experience that adds a special dimension to your time in Bhutan.
query_hints: Dance with Monks- Rituals Of Bhutan
